subject: Business
title: Building Long-Term Negotiation Relationships
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Building Long-Term Negotiation Relationships.

hook.text: You crushed them in the negotiation. You got everything. They'll never do business with you again.

buildup.text: One-shot negotiations reward aggression. Repeat negotiations reward fairness and trust.

discovery.text: In business, you negotiate with the same people repeatedly: suppliers, partners, employees.

twist.text: A deal where one side feels exploited creates resentment. They'll sabotage, delay, or abandon the relationship.

climax.text: The best long-term strategy: make the other side feel they won too. Fair deals create loyal partners.

punchline.text: Win the deal. But leave enough on the table to win the relationship.

quiz.question: Why is a 'win-win' outcome important in repeat negotiations?
options: Both sides return to the table willing to cooperate again
It's required by law in most contracts
It always results in higher profits for both sides
